RT @LBofHavering: It‚Äôs certainly wet out there, our teams have been out across the borough again this week clearing gullies & drains. Any c‚Ä¶

@PhilFarmVet @sunkfarmer @westyeo @pastoralview @wheat_daddy @agricontract @EnvAgency You said: "..without long term and persistent action..."

I have read the thread. I am now asking you what your suggestions are for long term and persistent action.

@Drystonesonnet @sunkfarmer @westyeo @pastoralview @wheat_daddy @agricontract @EnvAgency Please read the thread as a thread. Jono's suggestion was not to build on flood plains. All I was saying is that the levels are and always will be mainly flood plains and not building on them isn't an option. They need to be managed.
@PhilFarmVet @sunkfarmer @westyeo @pastoralview @wheat_daddy @agricontract @EnvAgency So what do you propose?
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Shouldn't this also be being reported to @Ofwat and @OfwatChiefExec the regulator, to get a grip?!
RT @MarkAvery: 4/? Big future role for public in monitoring compliance with the coming regulations and their inadequacy @stoptheshoot @NYMM‚Ä¶

@westyeo @sunkfarmer @pastoralview @wheat_daddy @Drystonesonnet @agricontract @EnvAgency My point is that land will always be a flood risk. Yes it is manageable, but not building on flood plains is not an option.
